availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: David B. Booker (Simpson County, Kentucky, tanner)

body.p: Simpson County, Kentucky, tanner. Kentucky native. Married to Nancy Booker. Father of Mary F. Booker, William Booker, Laurence Booker, Thomas Booker, and Henry Booker. Farmer in Simpson County, Kentucky, in 1850. Owned four enslaved persons in Simpson County in 1850. Tanner in Simpson County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Simpson County, p. 68B.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Simpson County, p. 888.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Simpson County, Franklin, p. 138.
Find A Grave, "D. B. Booker (3 Apr 1810-21 Jul 1885)," Memorial #149251249, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/149251249 (accessed August 31, 2020).
